data: Found in 1958 on the site of ancient Halaesa, as a chance surface find, in the area immediately to the north/north-east of the church of S. Maria dei Palazzi.
Seen in 2017 in the office of the Rector of Messina University
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
University of Messina, office of the Rector
Association pour l’encouragement des études greques, « Bulletin épigraphique », Bulletin épigraphique, 1888, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/797735566
Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l'étude du vocabulaire grec colonial
L. Dubois, Inscriptions Grecques Dialectales de Sicile : Contribution à l’étude Du Vocabulaire Grec Colonial, CEFR 119 (Rome: Ecole française de Rome, 1989)
F. Ghinatti, Assemblee Greche d’Occidente (Turin: Società editrice internazionale, 1996)
Giacomo Manganaro, «La provincia Romana», in La Sicilia antica, a c. di E. Gabba e G. Vallet, vol. 2.2 (Naples, 1980), 415–61
Tre principii della epigrafia greca: l'autopsia, la "serie", il contesto
Giacomo Manganaro, «Tre principii della epigrafia greca: l’autopsia, la “serie”, il contesto», Zeitschrift für Papyrologie und Epigraphik 135 (2001): 63–72
Nuove epigrafi greche da Halaesa Archonidea. Dati inediti sulle Tabulae Halaesinae e su una città della Sicilia tardo-ellenistica
Emiliano Arena, Nuove Epigrafi Greche Da Halaesa Archonidea. Dati Inediti Sulle Tabulae Halaesinae e Su Una Città Della Sicilia Tardo-Ellenistica, BAR IS 3017 (Oxford: BAR Publishing, 2020)
Le nuove epigrafi da Halaesa Archonidaea e le Tabulae Halaesinae: un primo bilancio
Emiliano Arena, «Le nuove epigrafi da Halaesa Archonidaea e le Tabulae Halaesinae: un primo bilancio», Scienze dell’Antichità 29, fasc. 2 (2023): 41–55

οἱ μισθωσάμενοι εἰ καὶ τοῦ κλάρου μηδὲ τὸ ἥμισσον σπείρωντι, ἀποδίδοντον τῷ ἐνιαυτῷ τὰς δεκάτας· τούτων οἱ ἀντιποιησάμενοι ἀτελείας κα ταβάλλοντον παρὰ τοὺς ταμίας ἐπιδέκατον καὶ ὀμνύντον οἱ καταβάλλοντες ὡς ὑπεράνω γέγραπται ἐπικλαρών τον οἱ πρόβουλοι κριτὰς τοῖς ἀντιποιησαμένοις τρεῖς πολίτας ἐκ βουλᾶς καὶ συγκλήτου, τὰν μὲν ὑπὲρ δέκα μὴ νεωτέρους ἐτῶν τριάκοντα καὶ ἀφαιρέοντον ἕνα παρ’ ἕνα ὡς αὐτοῖς δοκεῖ καλῶς ἔχειν ἕως κα καταλειφθέωντι τρεῖς, τὰν δὲ ὑπὲρ μὴ νεωτέρους ἐτῶν ἴκοσι καὶ ἀφαιρέοντον ὡσαύτως ἅπαντας ἕως κα καταλειφθέωντι ἑπτά· ἁ δὲ κλάρωσις γινέσθω μετα ξὺ τᾶν δέκα ἀφαιρεθένταν ἕνα παρ’ ἕνα καὶ δ κριτᾶν τὰν ζαμίαν
university of messina, office of the rector

10[νεωτέρους ἐτῶν ἴκ]οσι καὶ ἀφαιρέοντον ὡσαύ[τως ἅπαντας ἕως κα]

14[---]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • text of Manganaro 2001, pending transcription of autopsy

translation

commentary

The precise relationship of this fragment to the principal fragments of the cadastral inscription (ISic001174) remains uncertain. The fragmentary text is variously interpreted to refer to arrangements for land distribution or leasing, or for the resolution of disputes of ownership; in any event, some form of contextual relationship with the cadastral text seems highly likely, whether actually part of the same stone or not. Arena has recently highlighted the physical difference with the other known fragments (this fragment is about half the thickness of those known from the cadastral text), although the variability even across this one piece indicates that this cannot by itself be definitive. It remains the most prudent option to treat this as a separate, even if closely connected text.

commentary

The precise relationship of this fragment to the principal fragments of the cadastral inscription (ISic001174) remains uncertain. The fragmentary text is variously interpreted to refer to arrangements for land distribution or leasing, or for the resolution of disputes of ownership; in any event, some form of contextual relationship with the cadastral text seems highly likely, whether actually part of the same stone or not. Arena has recently highlighted the physical difference with the other known fragments (this fragment is about half the thickness of those known from the cadastral text), although the variability even across this one piece indicates that this cannot by itself be definitive. It remains the most prudent option to treat this as a separate, even if closely connected text.
